name: OpenSPP
description: OpenSPP is an integrated and digital social protection information system that enables governments and humanitarian agencies to streamline the creation and management of assistance programs.

SDGs.evidenceText: OpenSPP enables governments and humanitarian agencies to support the underprivileged through assistance programs.
OpenSPP can be used to distribute food assistance to the most vulnerable populations thanks to offline registration and advance targeting.
OpenSPP can be used to implement antenatal and postnatal programs to ensure maternal and child well-being.
OpenSPP can be used to implement school feeding programs to provide both educational and health benefits to the most vulnerable children.
OpenSPP targeting, monitoring and data analytics tools allow for the integration of gender considerations into all aspects of a social protection program – from intent and design to implementation.

OpenSPP targeting, monitoring and data analytics tools allow for the integration of inequality considerations into all aspects of a social protection program – from intent and design to implementation.
OpenSPP is partnering with governments, humanitarian agencies, the open source community, and the private sector to accelerate progress towards the achievement of SDGs.
